parts.text:
{
  "context": "The speaker uses an analogy of a boat trip captain to illustrate the importance of how a speaker presents themselves.",
  "questions": [
    {
      "correctAnswer": "B",
      "difficulty": "easy",
      "explanation": "The speaker uses the scenario of a boat trip to introduce the main point about being a speaker.",
      "options": [
        "A) A family vacation",
        "B) A boat trip",
        "C) A business meeting",
        "D) A public speech"
      ],
      "question": "What scenario does the speaker initially describe?",
      "type": "main_idea"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "A",
      "difficulty": "easy",
      "explanation": "The speaker explicitly states, 'The point is, when you are the speaker, you are the captain for that journey.'",
      "options": [
        "A) The speaker is like the captain of a journey.",
        "B) The captain is always nervous before a trip.",
        "C) Passengers should always greet the captain.",
        "D) Boat trips are dangerous."
      ],
      "question": "What is the main point the speaker is trying to make?",
      "type": "main_idea"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "C",
      "difficulty": "easy",
      "explanation": "The transcript mentions the captain saying, 'Hi, my name is Montana Von Fleiss, I’ll be your captain for this journey. Let’s have a great trip.'",
      "options": [
        "A) To apologize for the weather",
        "B) To ask for directions",
        "C) To introduce herself and welcome passengers",
        "D) To explain the safety procedures"
      ],
      "question": "What is the desired behavior of the captain when greeting passengers?",
      "type": "detail"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "D",
      "difficulty": "easy",
      "explanation": "The transcript states, 'The point is, when you are the speaker, you are the captain for that journey, and how you show up really matters.'",
      "options": [
        "A) The captain's name",
        "B) The destination of the boat",
        "C) The weather conditions",
        "D) How the speaker presents themselves"
      ],
      "question": "According to the speaker, what really matters when you are the captain of a journey?",
      "type": "detail"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "B",
      "difficulty": "medium",
      "explanation": "The transcript contrasts the desired captain's greeting with a less confident one, implying the initial captain's greeting was not ideal.",
      "options": [
        "A) The captain was very confident.",
        "B) The captain's initial greeting was hesitant.",
        "C) The passengers were excited to leave.",
        "D) The boat trip was cancelled."
      ],
      "question": "What can be inferred about the captain's initial greeting?",
      "type": "inference"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "A",
      "difficulty": "medium",
      "explanation": "The transcript uses the word 'journey' in the context of a boat trip and then applies it to being a speaker, implying a process or experience.",
      "options": [
        "A) An experience or process",
        "B) A physical destination",
        "C) A short break",
        "D) A type of vehicle"
      ],
      "question": "In the context of the analogy, what does 'journey' most likely refer to?",
      "type": "vocabulary"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "C",
      "difficulty": "medium",
      "explanation": "The speaker says, 'Nope. Get me off of this boat.' after describing the hesitant captain, indicating a negative reaction.",
      "options": [
        "A) Excitement",
        "B) Indifference",
        "C) Discomfort or distrust",
        "D) Curiosity"
      ],
      "question": "What is the speaker's implied reaction to the hesitant captain?",
      "type": "inference"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "D",
      "difficulty": "medium",
      "explanation": "The transcript includes 'Uh, so... (Exhales) So, uh... (Laughter) Oh, boy... Sorry.' which indicates hesitation and nervousness.",
      "options": [
        "A) Calm and assured",
        "B) Enthusiastic and energetic",
        "C) Professional and direct",
        "D) Hesitant and nervous"
      ],
      "question": "How does the speaker portray the initial captain's demeanor?",
      "type": "detail"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "A",
      "difficulty": "hard",
      "explanation": "The speaker contrasts the two captain introductions to highlight the impact of delivery on the audience's perception and trust.",
      "options": [
        "A) The impact of a speaker's delivery on audience perception.",
        "B) The importance of knowing the captain's name.",
        "C) The best way to start a boat trip.",
        "D) The dangers of traveling by sea."
      ],
      "question": "What underlying message is conveyed by contrasting the two captain introductions?",
      "type": "inference"
    },
    {
      "correctAnswer": "B",
      "difficulty": "hard",
      "explanation": "The speaker's use of laughter after the hesitant captain's introduction, followed by 'Nope. Get me off of this boat,' suggests a critical or even mocking tone towards poor delivery.",
      "options": [
        "A) Sympathetic",
        "B) Critical or sarcastic",
        "C) Neutral and objective",
        "D) Encouraging"
      ],
      "question": "What is the speaker's likely attitude towards the first captain's introduction?",
      "type": "inference"
    }
  ]
}
